body.section:
This topic describes limitations of and important notes pertaining to the Identity service.Notes Domains
Domains can be created and managed by the Horizon web interface, Keystone API, and OpenStackClient CLI.
The configuration of external authentication systems requires the creation and usage of domains.
All configurations are managed by creating and editing specific configuration files.
End users can authenticate to a particular project and domain through the Horizon web interface, Keystone API, and OpenStackClient CLI.
A new Horizon login page that requires a domain entry is now installed by default.
Keystone-to-Keystone Federation
Keystone-to-Keystone (K2K) federation provides the ability to authenticate once with one cloud and then use these credentials to access resources on other federated clouds.
All configurations are managed by creating and editing specific configuration files.
Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
The Keystone architecture provides support for MFA deployments.
MFA lets you deploy nonpassword based authentication, such as a token providing hardware and text messages.
Hierarchical Multitenancy
Provides the ability to create subprojects within a domain-project hierarchy.

section.title: Limitations
section.b: Authentication with external authentication systems (LDAP, Active Directory (AD), or Identity Providers)

ul.li: No Horizon web portal support currently exists for the creation and management of external authentication system configurations.
No Horizon web portal support currently exists for the creation and management of federation configurations.
All end user authentication is available only through the Keystone API and OpenStackClient CLI.
MFA support is a custom configuration requiring HPE Professional Services support.
MFA drivers are not included with and need to be provided by a specific MFA vendor.

This function requires additional support from various OpenStack services to be functional. It is a noncore function in HPE Helion OpenStack and is not ready for either proof of concept or production deployments.

section.b: Missing quota information for compute resources

p.note: An error message will appear in the default Horizon page if you are running a Swift-only deployment (no Compute service). In this configuration, you will not see any quota information for Compute resources and will see the following error message:

p.i: The Compute service is not installed or is not configured properly. No information is available for Compute resources.

section.p: This error message is expected because no Compute service is configured for this deployment. You can ignore this error message.
